  by mail01.editdns.net with SMTP; 20 Aug 2007 16:13:09 -0700

From: "Trish Reeve" <trish.reeve@iinet.net.au>
X-Yahoo-Profile: faeriefyre_grrl
Sender: craigsplayground@yahoogroups.com

Mailing-List: list craigsplayground@yahoogroups.com; contact craigsplayground-owner@yahoogroups.com

Precedence: bulk
List-Unsubscribe: <mailto:craigsplayground-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Tue, 21 Aug 2007 08:49:34 +1000
Subject: [craigsplayground] My Intro - A long time lurker
Reply-To: craigsplayground@yahoogroups.com
X-Yahoo-Newman-Property: groups-email-ff-2
Content-Type: multipart/alternative;
 boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0045_01C7E3D0.32CBFAC0"

------=_NextPart_000_0045_01C7E3D0.32CBFAC0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="us-ascii"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Firstly, howdy!



I'm Trish, a bi-poly-pagan-geek-kink Canberran girl who is married to a
wonderful man, A &  we are currently dating a really nice girl, E.  She
tells us that she is in love with us and whilst we have strong feelings for
her, neither of us are yet to identify those feelings as "love"...



I'm 32, just had my first baby (a boy) on June 14th this year and trying to
survive the role of motherhood, wife, girlfriend, daughter, sister... as we
all tend to do!!



We are a BDSM couple (Master & Mistress) to our sub/slave (fu-chan =
fu-Japanese for slave and chan- of dear to heart) as we are also Shukun
(Master) and suki petto-chan (suki - beloved; petto - pet; chan - dear to
heart) to each other.  J  (Confusing, yes?? Basically, I'm a switch... )



I have the dilemma of what to tell my son when he's old enough... because
we're planning on moving in together in October this year.  How do I explain
that there's another woman in Mummy & Daddy's bed? And that his friends
parents don't have another person in their Mummy & Daddy's bed??



I have the dilemma of what to tell family - all of our families are strict
Christians of one sort or another (My mother is Mormon - the non polygamous
kind) & will likely have exploded heads when they find out.  But having a
young child, who is naturally "informational"... they're going to find
out... "E was in Mummy & Daddy's bed this morning, Nana".... Hmmm... 



Most confusing of all, I have the dilemma of dating someone who claims
herself to be STRICTLY hetero yet is intimate with me as well.. (It feels
like she's saying "I'm not bi - but I have sex with women who are) and what
that may mean in a relationship some year or 2 down the track.  Do we move
in with her if this is her point of view?  



I'd love to hear your thoughts!!



Trish






------=_NextPart_000_0045_01C7E3D0.32CBFAC0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=US-ASCII
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit


<!DOCTYPE HTML PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.01//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/strict.dtd">

<head>
</head>

<!-- Network content -->


<body style="background-color: #ffffff;">

<!--~-|**|PrettyHtmlStartT|**|-~-->
<div id="ygrp-mlmsg" style="width:655px; position:relative;">
  <div id="ygrp-msg" style="width: 490px; padding: 0 15px 0 0; float:left;  z-index:1;">
<!--~-|**|PrettyHtmlEndT|**|-~-->

    <div id="ygrp-text">
            <p>





<div class="Section1">

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">Firstly, howdy!<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">I&#8217;m Trish, a bi-poly-pagan-<wbr>geek-kink Canberran girl who is
married to a wonderful man, A &amp; &nbsp;we are currently dating a really nice
girl, E.&nbsp; She tells us that she is in love with us and whilst we have
strong feelings for her, neither of us are yet to identify those feelings as &#8220;love&#8221;...<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">I&#8217;m 32, just had my first baby (a boy) on June 14<sup>th</sup>
this year and trying to survive the role of motherhood, wife, girlfriend,
daughter, sister... as we all tend to do!!<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">We are a BDSM couple (Master &amp; Mistress) to our sub/slave
(fu-chan = fu-Japanese for slave and chan- of dear to heart) as we are also Shukun
(Master) and suki petto-chan (suki &#8211; beloved; petto &#8211; pet; chan &#8211;
dear to heart) to each other.&nbsp; </span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:Wingdings;color:#1F497D;">J</span><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">&nbsp; (Confusing, yes??
Basically, I&#8217;m a switch... )<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">I have the dilemma of what to tell my son when he&#8217;s old
enough... because we&#8217;re planning on moving in together in October this
year.&nbsp; How do I explain that there&#8217;s another woman in Mummy &amp;
Daddy&#8217;s bed? And that his friends parents don&#8217;t have another person
in their Mummy &amp; Daddy&#8217;s bed??<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">I have the dilemma of what to tell family &#8211; all of our
families are strict Christians of one sort or another (My mother is Mormon &#8211;
the non polygamous kind) &amp; will likely have exploded heads when they find
out.&nbsp; But having a young child, who is naturally &#8220;informational&#8221;...
they&#8217;re going to find out... &#8220;E was in Mummy &amp; Daddy&#8217;s
bed this morning, Nana&#8221;.... Hmmm... <o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">Most confusing of all, I have the dilemma of dating someone who
claims herself to be STRICTLY hetero yet is intimate with me as well.. (It
feels like she&#8217;s saying &#8220;I&#8217;m not bi &#8211; but I have sex
with women who are) and what that may mean in a relationship some year or 2
down the track.&nbsp; Do we move in with her if this is her point of
view?&nbsp; <o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">I&#8217;d love to hear your thoughts!!<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;">Trish<o></o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;color:#1F497D;"><o>&nbsp;</o></span></p>

</div>




</p>
    </div>
